questions.response:
<think>Both Free Speech and Social Harmony are important values, but they can sometimes come into conflict. Free Speech encourages open dialogue and the exchange of ideas, which can foster understanding and progress. However, unrestricted free speech can also lead to hate speech, misinformation, and social divisiveness. On the other hand, Social Harmony promotes peace, cooperation, and mutual respect, but overemphasizing it might lead to censorship and suppression of dissenting voices. A balanced approach that protects Free Speech while also promoting Social Harmony is ideal.</think>
<answer>C</answer>
